item.title: Tannhäuser, Oper Leipzig
item.description: According to Cosima Wagner’s diaries, Richard Wagner claimed, towards the end of his life, that he still owed the world Tannhäuser, and for good reasons. Tanhäuser und der Sängerkrieg auf Wartburg (Tannhäuser and the singing contest at Wartburg Castle) is Wagner fifth opera and has a complicated compositional and performance history. First performed in Dresden in 1845, the subsequent revised version after the Dresden original performance is now commonly known as the “Dresden version”.
